info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 10 at 3:47PM CDT by NWS Aberdeen SD
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota...
James River at Columbia affecting Brown County.
.For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...James River at Columbia.
* WHEN...From this evening until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, flooding of the lower lying agricultural areas begins.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening and continue rising to a crest of 15.2 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr.
The next statement will be issued by late Monday night at midnight CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
